qas.question: What was the principal social institution of the republic during the French Enlightenment?
Was French society open or fearful of female participation in the literary sphere during the Enlightenment?
What female occupation allowed women to play an essential part in the French Enlightenment?
Which event destroyed the former patronage and corporatism of France and allowed women to participate in society?

context: Many women played an essential part in the French Enlightenment, due to the role they played as <a2_0>salonnières<a2_0/> in Parisian salons, as the contrast to the male philosophes. The <a0_0>salon<a0_0/> was the principal social institution of the republic, and "became the civil working spaces of the project of Enlightenment." Women, as salonnières, were "the legitimate governors of [the] potentially unruly discourse" that took place within. While women were marginalized in the public culture of the Ancien Régime, the <a3_0>French Revolution<a3_0/> destroyed the old cultural and economic restraints of patronage and corporatism (guilds), <a1_0>open<a1_0/>ing French society to female participation, particularly in the literary sphere.
